intro: Asarum versicolor f. non-versicolor, commonly known as the non-variegated form of the purple wintergreen, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Aristolochiaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped, dark green leaves and clusters of small, pale greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has a distinctive, aromatic root system. Its botanical features make it a unique and valuable species for ecological and horticultural studies.
